availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

creation.placeName: San Francisco, San Francisco County, California

body.p:
City and County of San Francisco
State of California } SS.
Nov 9/64
E D S
29

I, N. Proctor Smith, duly appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky, a Commissioner for the State of Kentucky, resident at the City and County of San Francisco, in the State of California, do Solemnly swear, that I will well and faithfully execute and perform all the duties of Such Commissioner under and by virtue of the laws of Said State of Kentucky.
Sworn and Subscribed before me this the Ninth day of November A. D. 1864

figure.ab:
N. PROCTOR SMITH COMMISSIONER
FOR THE STATE OF KENTUCKY
STATE OF CALIFORNIA

body.p:
E. D. Sawyer
District Judge
Fourth Judicial District

Comr of Deeds
Oath of N. Proctor Smith
California
filed 6th Dec/64
